snippet: A group of protesters who have seized the government headquarters in Donetsk, Ukraine, was urged by local politicians to give up and hand over its weapons.
abstract: Group of unruly Russian-speaking protesters occupies 11-story Ukrainian government building in eastern city Donetsk and declares it newly proclaimed Donetsk People’s Republic; nobody really expects the claims to stand, but it underscores rifts in language, culture, and politics that show no sign of fading.
lead_paragraph: A group of protesters who have seized the government headquarters in Donetsk, Ukraine, was urged by local politicians to give up and hand over its weapons.

headline.main: In Eastern Ukraine, a One-Building, Pro-Russia Realm Persists Despite Criticism
headline.print_headline: In Eastern Ukraine, a One-Building, Pro-Russia Realm Persists Despite Criticism
